channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9142] Mutation#getFamilyMap() return type change between HBase 94 and 96 breaks downstream apps
item.description:
In Hbase-94, Mutation#getFamilyMap() had signature:
public Map<byte[],List<KeyValue>> getFamilyMap()

In Hbase-96 it is:
public NavigableMap<byte[],List<? extends Cell>> getFamilyMap()

I understand this might not be an easy fix or even a possible one - but it breaks downstream apps in a nasty way. If the app needs to process the individual columns, then the whole logic is now different. Is there a way to work around this, if this cannot be fixed?
item.summary: Mutation#getFamilyMap() return type change between HBase 94 and 96 breaks downstream apps

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Could I restore the old call, deprecate it, and then make a new method named getFamilies w/ above signature?

Yes, the new method will need to be renamed. We'd need to restore the old method with the same signature to "unbreak" the downstream apps - but that would break the new method as they both would differ only in return type. So the new method would need to be renamed to something else like you suggested above.
Chatted with Stack offline, I'll take this one.

First – I think life is easier in you should probably create a new hbase95 sink. – this is a case where 0.94 didn't specify external visibility explictly yet and we didn't preserve compat.

I added a method back and named the new method as getFamilyCellMap. Along the way, I went down the rathole of removing what I believe is a java collection of generics anti-pattern along the way. (which if it ends up being clean, we should get in to 0.95 before the api freezes). This may have been intentional by my gut says it should be removed.

Specifically it seems that defining this method with List<? extends Cell> where List<Cell> is sufficient has caused superfluous casts and extra types to percolated throughout the code. Having gone through -client, -common, and -server, none of the uses of the List instances require methods in Cell's implementor KeyValue that aren't in the Cell interface. A List<Cell> can hold KeyValue instances doesn't need have a List<KeyValue> type. Since the maps is essentially exposed and can be used for read/write access, it should be the collection element typed should be typed invariantly. See [1] for short primer and examples.

[1] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Covariance_and_contravariance_(computer_science)

Trunk version only renames the NavigableMap<...> getFamilyMap() -> getFamilyCellMap.

The 0.95 version does that and restores the 0.94 api compatible method that is marked as deprecated.
Removing the <? extends Cell> may come in a follow-on patch

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12596823/hbase-9142-0.95.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 18 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6654//console

This message is automatically generated.
reupload to have jira test test the correct patch.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12596833/hbase-9142-trunk.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 18 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6655//console

This message is automatically generated.

0.95 branch moved under me. The v2 version is what I committed.

Thanks for the review Elliott!

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12596957/hbase-9142-trunk.v2.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 18 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6664//console

This message is automatically generated.

FAILURE: Integrated in hbase-0.95-on-hadoop2 #225 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/hbase-0.95-on-hadoop2/225/)
HBASE-9142 Mutation#getFamilyMap() return type change between HBase 94 and 96 breaks downstream apps

For 0.95/0.96, we need to preserve the getFamilyMap signature through a deprecation cycle. The new
method needs to be present alongside the old in 0.95, so we rename the method with the new signature
to getFamilyCellMap() in both trunk and 0.95, and restore a deprecated version of the old in 0.95. (jmhsieh: rev 1512102)

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
HBASE-9142 Mutation#getFamilyMap() return type change between HBase 94 and 96 breaks downstream apps

For 0.95/0.96, we need to preserve the getFamilyMap signature through a deprecation cycle. The new
method needs to be present alongside the old in 0.95, so we rename the method with the new signature
to getFamilyCellMap() in both trunk and 0.95, and restore a deprecated version of the old in 0.95.
